FOREIGN AFFAIRS CLUB OF INDIA

Regd. Under Government Of India

SINCE 1992

"a brief profile over the year"

In this rapidly changing world new developments are taking place everyday, every moment, therefore a student of diplomacy and international politics is keen to keep himself abreast of changing strategies, tactics and behavioural patterns and newly emerging perceptions in modern day diplomacy. A diplomat of tomorrow will certainly like to have optimum knowledge of complex national and international issues.

Foreign Affairs Club of India (FACI) is organisation whose main objective is to supplement government’s foreign policy initiatives and also to train a new cadre of diplomats and academicians who will prove to be capable and competent to understand new techniques and intricacies in modern day diplomacy.

FACI also aims to undertake noble causes in the service of humanity, especially towards the upliftment of the underprivileged and down trodden in the society.

FACI is a non- governmental organization having more than 500 intellectuals all over the country as its members who are richly contributing to international understanding, disarmament and world peace through their multifarious activities.

The idea of FACI sprang up in the minds of India’s leading foreign policy experts, politicians, academicians, journalists and legal luminaries in early eighties. Prof. Dr. S.S. Mohapatra, who himself is an authority on foreign affairs and visiting professor to several foreign universities took up the matter with the then President of India, Giani Zail the Singh, who welcomed the birth of such an organization which would provide a think tank to the in government formulation of its foreign policy. He extended his full support and very kindly agreed to be the founder chief patron of FACI.

The formal inauguration of FACI, however, was done on December 9, 1986, by former Union Minister and India’s ambassador to the Soviet Union, Mr. I.K. Gujral, now the Prime Minister of India.

A former External Affairs Minister, Raja Dinesh Singh was installed as the first President who, later, was succeeded by an equally important national leader, Mr. K.R. Narayanan, now the President of India.

At present Prof. S.S. Mohapatra is the Chairman, and the editor of Unity International, Mr. R.N. Anil, is the Secretary-General, the Chairman of Super Circle Group of Industries, Mr. Jagjyoti Jain, is the Executive Director and the Chairman of Sandeep Group of Companies, Mr. J.L. Malhotra is the ViceChairman

Among those who joined FACI in the initial stages or who took active part in its lively debates and round table discussions one can mention the names of senior national leaders and now Union Ministers, Prof. Saifuddin Soz, Mr. Jaipal Reddy, Mr. Charuranand Mishra and Mr. B.S Ramwalia, Former Loksabha speaker Mr. Baliram Bhagat, Dr. G.S Dhilon and Mr. Ravi Ray, Deputy chairman of Rajyasabha Mrs. Najma Haftulla, Former ministers Mr. N.K.P Salve, Mr. R.L Bhatia, Mr. Dinesh Goswami, M.r Magan bhai Barot and Mr. Tulsidas Jadav former governors, Mr. Homi j Telyarkhan, Mr B.S. Reddy, Mr Mohammed Yunus Salim and Dr. Bhisham Narain Singh, legal luminaries, Justice Bahrul Islam, Justice HR Khanna, Justice A N. Sen, Justice R.S. Narula and Mr. Balraj Trikha, former vicechancellors, Prof. Ali Ashraf, Prof. M.S. Agwani and Prof 1.C. Mohapatra, senior professors from Jawaharlal Nehru University, Delhi University and Jamia Milia Islamia, Prof. Rasheeduddin Khan, Prof M Zuberi, Prof. Ashwini K. Ray, Prof. K.P. Misra, Prof. Zaheer Masood Quraishi, Prof JD Sethi and Prof. Zafar Ahmed Nizami, senior journalists and political analysts, Dr.Bhabani Sengupta, Mr. Rai Singh and Mr B.M. Sinha, former foreign secretaries, Mr. Romesh Bhandari and Mr. A.P. Venkateshwaran, India’s former Permanent Representatives in the United Nations, Rajeshwar Dyal and Mr Rikhi Jaipal, senior parliamentarians, Mr Daulatsinhji Jadeja, Mr. V Narayanasamy, Mr. MC Bhandare, Mr. P. Upendra, Mr. M.S. Gurupadswamy, Mr. KK Birla, Mr. Ghulam Rasool Mattoo, Mr V Gopalasamy, Mr. R.R. Sahu, Mr. P. Unnikrishnan, Mr. D. Basumatari, Mr. Suryavanshi, Mrs. Krishna Kaul, Prof NC. Prashar, Prof. N.G. Ranga and Prof. Parag Chaliha. Among the foreign dignitaries and eminent scholars one can mention the names of a Noble Laureate Mr Nikolai Basov, Prof GL Bondarevsky, Mr Yuri Vassilev and Dr. TL Shaumlin of Russia. Prof. Hans Koechler from Austria, Dr Hans Lunder from Norway, a Lady of the Kelly and Sophia ambassadors and senior diplomats from U.K., U.S.A., Russia, Germany, China, Yugoslavia, Vietnam, Afghanistan, Palestine, Iraq, Laos, Cambodia, Myanmar, Poland, Romania, Hungary, Norway, Uganda, Tanzania, Cyprus and Argentina,

During the years FACI has established close links with several international organizations such Institute of Alternative Studies, Oslo, Stockholm Peace and Research Institute, Sweden, Centre for Strategic and International Studies, Washington D.C., International Affairs, Institute for World Peace, Japan, Gorbachev Foundation, Moscow, Centre for Spirituality, Bridgewater, U.K., New Horizons, Managua and International Progress Organisation, Austria.

Since its inception FACI has organised hundreds of debates, round table discussions, seminars and symposia. Just to mention a few important one: “India’s Peace Initiatives in Afghanistan”, “Nehru and NAMin the Changing World Scenario”, “Super Power Summit and Global Expectations”, “India and USSR in Quest of Peace”, “Delhi Declaration a Step Forward Towards World Peace”, “One Day Military Spending for Global Peace”, Sino-Soviet Summit and its Impact on Asia Pacific”, India’s Foreign Policy after Independence”, “Regional Conflicts in Global Context and the Role of United Nations”, “New Era of Stability in Asia”, etc.

FACI is now in the process of affiliation with the United Nations, after its off-shoot “Trans National Academy of Diplomacy and Peace” gets recognition.
